sub_topic: Determining the treewidth of a graph.
message_1:
What is the treewidth of a complete graph K6?

Note: The treewidth of a graph is defined as the minimum width of a tree decomposition of the graph. The tree decomposition is a representation of the graph by a tree, where each node of the tree corresponds to a subset of vertices, and each edge corresponds to a separator set of vertices that separates the subsets on either side of the edge. The width of a tree decomposition is defined as the size of the largest separator set minus one.
message_2: The treewidth of a complete graph K_n is n-1. In the case of a complete graph K6, the treewidth is 6-1 = 5.
